headline.main: Philip Morris Shares Gain After Recall of Cigarettes

docs.lead_paragraph: Shares of the Philip Morris Companies began recovering yesterday after the company tried to reassure Wall Street that it was moving quickly to complete its $100 million recall of more than eight billion filter cigarettes. The company's shares rose 87.5 cents, to $70.75, on the New York Stock Exchange. The gain did not make up for the loss of $2 a share on Friday, when the company announced a half-hour before the close of trading that it was recalling 36 of its 238 cigarette products because a manufacturing defect in its filter tips could cause "temporary discomfort" to smokers.
